article: May was born with a cleft palate . When she was a little girl, she had to _ the jikes from naughty chidren who teased her about her misshaped lip. With all the teasing, Mary grew up _ the fact that she was"diffrernt". She was _ that no one, outside her family,could ever love her until she _ Mrs. Leonard's class. In Mrs. Leonards' school at that time, it was _ for teachers to give their children an annual _ test. However, in Mary's case, in addition to her cleft palate, she was hardly able to hear out of one ear. _ not to let the other children have another" _ "to point out, she would _ when her bad ear was tested each year. The "hearing test"was _ by having a child walk to the classroom door,turn sideways, _ one ear with a fingre, and then _ what the teacher whispered. When Mary had to turn her bad ear towards her teacher she would _ to cover her good ear. She knew that teachers _ often say things like,"The sky is blue,"or"What color are your shoes?"But not on that day. Surely, God _ seven words in Mrs. Leonard's mouth that _ Mary's life forever. When the test came, Mary heard:" I wish you were my little girl."You can imagine how deeply these words _ Mary. Yes, affirming words are _ to say to the people around you. While words from a godly teacher can soften a heart, words form you can powerfully set the _ of another One's life.
